title: Browns' Sanders to wear 12, like mentor Brady
content: The Browns on Tuesday announced jersey numbers for their rookies, and Shedeur Sanders will wear No. 12, as the No. 2 he wore in high school and college was selected by veteran DeAndre Carter.

title: LIV's Johnson gets invite to PGA Championship
content: LIV Golf's Dustin Johnson has been given a special invitation to compete in next week's PGA Championship.

title: Sovereignty skips Preakness, run at Triple Crown
content: Kentucky Derby winner Sovereignty will not run in the Preakness Stakes and instead will rest before the Belmont Stakes, ending any hopes for a Triple Crown.

title: Gators, Golden agree to 6-year, $40.5M extension
content: Florida coach Todd Golden, fresh off a national title, has agreed to a six-year, $40.5 million contract extension through the 2030-31 season.

title: Yankees designate vet Carrasco for assignment
content: Veteran right-hander Carlos Carrasco was designated for assignment by the New York Yankees, the club announced Tuesday.

title: Williams wilts again, sees ERA top 10 as Yankee
content: New York reliever Devin Williams' nightmare season continued on Monday night with another poor outing in the Yankees' 4-3 loss to the San Diego Padres, as the right-hander was charged with three runs, increasing his ERA to 10.03 in 14 games this season.

title: Clemson, ND to announce 12-year schedule deal
content: Clemson and Notre Dame are set to announce a 12-year scheduling agreement that will pit the two college football powers against each other annually through 2038.

title: OKC's Presti named NBA's executive of the year
content: Sam Presti of the Oklahoma City Thunder was announced Tuesday as the NBA's executive of the year, the reward for building that team into a juggernaut that won a league-best 68 games this season.

title: 📈NFL Power Rankings: Re-shuffling after the draft
content: Our panel of experts ranked every NFL team from 1 to 32. Which franchises improved with their draft picks and offseason moves?

title: NFL experts debate the draft: Which teams have the most impactful rookie classes?
content: Could the Patriots' rookies make an immediate impact? Experts weigh in with their favorite classes and picks.

title: McDaniels on Curry? Mitchell’s volume shooting? Boston’s injuries? Six X factors in the second round
content: From players to coaching tactics to pace of play, these are six key factors that will be critical in the second round.

title: 'Job well done': Inside Gregg Popovich's unparalleled NBA legacy
content: Friends, colleagues, players and confidantes all agree: Popovich has impacted more people across the game than perhaps anyone in history.

title: Biggest lessons of the Stanley Cup playoffs so far -- and why they matter for Round 2 and beyond
content: With the opening round in the books, here are the top takeaways that will influence the rest of the playoffs.

title: Passan predicts MLB megadeals: Who will be next to get $100 million? $300 million? $600 million?!
content: These players are due to get paid -- from who will join the nine-figure club to who could break Juan Soto's record.

title: Joe Burrow, Simone Biles shine on the 2025 Met Gala's red carpet
content: Sabrina Ionescu, Breanna Stewart, Joe Burrow, Jonathan Owens and Saquon Barkley make their debuts at the 2025 Met Gala.

title: Everything to know about Monday's NBA draft lottery, from picks to what we're hearing
content: Draft experts Jonathan Givony and Jeremy Woo break down the odds, likely picks and best fits for prospects.

title: The worst good players: Which elite stars stink at passing? Who can't dribble or shoot?
content: Among the top Champions League players, who stinks at passing? Who can't run? Who shouldn't dribble? Here are the worst good players.

title: PSG get boost as Dembélé passed fit vs. Arsenal
content: Paris Saint-Germain received a boost ahead of Wednesday's Champions League semifinal second leg against Arsenal with Ousmane Dembélé passed fit.

title: Minister sorry to Liverpool fans over UCL final
content: France's former interior minister Gerald Darmanin has apologised to Liverpool fans for wrongly blaming them for the chaos before the 2022 Champions League final in Paris.

title: Source: Man Utd to resist any offers for Fernandes
content: A source has told ESPN that Bruno Fernandes is one of the few players whose future is seen as secure at Man United despite a battle to balance the club's books.

title: Sources: Madrid want Alexander-Arnold for CWC
content: Real Madrid want Trent Alexander-Arnold to join them for this summer's Club World Cup, sources have told ESPN, and now plan talks with Liverpool to negotiate his early release.

title: Raphinha on Barça revival: Xavi never rated me
content: Barcelona forward Raphinha has revealed his anger at the lack of football he played under Xavi Hernández, saying he feels his former coach never showed any real confidence in him.

title: Brazil want to decide new coach next week - chief
content: The Brazil Football Confederation (CBF) expect to name the men's national team coach by the end of next week "at the latest."

title: Paquetá in a 'nightmare' amid betting case - wife
content: West Ham United midfielder Lucas Paquetá's wife has said their family have been "living a nightmare for two years" after being involved in an investigation over match fixing.

title: Kane targets trophy 'number two' after title win
content: England striker Harry Kane said it feels sweet to finally end his career-long trophy drought after securing the Bundesliga title with Bayern Munich

title: Who will kick for Ravens after Justin Tucker release? A look at his likely successor
content: After drafting the Arizona kicker in the sixth round, the team will likely turn to Tyler Loop after releasing Tucker on Monday.

title: Risers and new entrants to our latest top 25
content: UConn climbs the ranks. Illinois and Creighton join the mix. See the fourth edition of our early top 25.

title: All eyes on WNBA, but Unrivaled looks to build on momentum for next season
content: After a successful inaugural season, Unrivaled's stakeholders must figure out how to build on the momentum.

title: An inside look at the day boxing took over New York's Times Square
content: How one of the most iconic places in New York City transformed from a tourist area to a boxing venue.

title: MMA divisional rankings: After win, did Cory Sandhagen even budge at bantamweight?
content: Here's a look at every weight class to determine the best of the best in UFC, Bellator, PFL and beyond.

title: Betting buzz: Stars, Jets to face off after braving remarkably long live odds
content: The Winnipeg Jets and Dallas Stars face off in the second round after braving long live odds in Game 7's.

title: Stock watch: Shelby Miller for saves?
content: Everything fantasy baseball managers need to know about which closers should be added, dropped, and more.

title: Bellingham ruled last season's Clásicos. Can he save Madrid's title hopes vs. Barça?
content: It's been a challenging second season for Jude Bellingham at Real Madrid, but Sunday's title-deciding Clásico is the perfect stage for him to step up.

title: Michele Kang is spending millions to scoop up women's soccer teams around the world. What's her plan?
content: Billionaire club owner Michele Kang speaks to ESPN about her new vision for women's soccer and the money she's pouring in to make it a reality.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United open talks with Osimhen
content: Initial talks have taken place between Manchester United and the representatives of on-loan Galatasaray striker Victor Osimhen. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Kirst, Kavanagh or English? Paul Carcaterra's big board for the 2025 PLL draft
content: ESPN's Paul Carcaterra ranks the 2025 PLL draft's top prospects and matches teams up with players who best fit their needs.

title: Villagers oppose plan to build bus shelter near a Tasmac outlet
content: Villagers fear safety of commuters, especially women, will be compromised. Collector says objections have been taken up with the district administration

title: Telangana invites citizens to apply online for curated entry to Miss World 2025
content: Citizens can register on Telangana Tourism website to be considered through a curated selection process

title: Osman Nagar reservoirs getting ready for inauguration
content: Built at a cost of ₹30 crore, under the ORR phase 2 and package 2 project, the reservoirs will provide drinking water to nearly 1 lakh people in the area

title: BMTC responds after video shows elderly man misbehaving with woman passenger
content: The incident reportedly took place on May 5 around 3.30 p.m. on bus number KA51 F 6204, operating on route 276/22 near Vidyaranyapura

title: Early monsoon? Rains over Nicobar islands by May 13
content: The normal onset date of the monsoon over Kerala is June 1, and it usually takes about 10 days for the system to reach Kerala from the Nicobar islands

title: Health and education are foundations of a good society: Azim Premji
content: 63,982 candidates awarded certificates at the 27th convocation of Rajiv Gandhi University of Health Sciences

title: CBI special court sentences Gali Janardhan Reddy, three others to seven-year jail term in illegal mining case
content: Apart from the BJP MLA from Karnataka, his relative B.V. Srinivas Reddy, MD, Obulapuram Mining Corporation; V.D. Rajagopal, then Director of the Mining Department; and Janardan Reddy’s personal assistant, Ali Khan, were also convicted in the case registered by the CBI nearly 16 years ago

title: How Twins In Madhya Pradesh Earned Double With Fake Degree
content: In what may turn out to the one of the most audacious education scams in Madhya Pradesh, twin sisters secured teaching jobs in separate government-run schools, using the same name and the same BA marksheet, which belonged to one of them.

title: What Is A Security Drill And What To Expect Today
content: A mock drill lets people rehearse what to do in a safe and controlled way, so they are ready if a real crisis happens.

title: 5 Bangladeshi Citizens Arrested For Illegal Infiltration In Assam
content: At least five Bangladeshi citizens were arrested and later pushed back by security personnel on Tuesday in Assam's South Salmara district on the charges of illegal infiltration.

title: India-Pak Tension Highlights: Security Drills To Be Held Across 244 Areas Today; PM Modi Slams Pakistan
content: India Pakistan Tensions Highlights: The Indian Air Force (IAF) will carry out a routine military exercise in Rajasthan, along the International Border with Pakistan, on Wednesday.

title: Meerut Woman Forced To Hand Over Kids To Pakistani Husband At Attari Border
content: An inconsolable Sana on Monday handed over her two small children, aged three and one, to her Pakistani husband at the Attari border, in the latest incident of families being separated.

title: Bhuwan Ribhu Becomes First Indian Lawyer To Receive World Law Congress Honour For Child Rights
content: For over two decades, Bhuwan Ribhu's legal fight against child exploitation earned him the World Jurist Association's Medal of Honour

title: Clash Over Tandoori Roti At Wedding Leads To Double Murder In UP, 6 Arrested
content: A dispute over the serving of tandoori roti during a wedding feast turned violent, resulting in the deaths of two men, one of them a minor, in Amethi district, police said on Tuesday.

title: India Secures 3-Year Exemption From Social Security Contribution In UK
content: India has secured a three-year exemption from social security contributions for domestic workers who are temporarily in the UK and their employers under the Double Contribution Convention Agreement (DCCA).

title: "Biggest Deal UK Has Done Since...": Keir Starmer In Phone Call With PM Modi
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Tuesday held a telephonic conversation with his UK counterpart, Keir Starmer, over the completion of the Free Trade Agreement (FTA), which the latter said was a "historic occasion" between the two countries.

title: "They Will Drop It To Nothing": Trump's Big Claim On India Tariffs
content: US President Donald Trump on Tuesday claimed India will its tariffs on imports from the US to "nothing". He shared no details on goods and sectors affected.

title: India Will Retaliate If EU Imposes Carbon Tax: Union Minister Piyush Goyal
content: India will impose retaliatory duties if the European Union goes ahead with its plan to levy a carbon tax on Indian products, Commerce and Industry Minister Piyush Goyal said on Tuesday.

title: UK Visa System Faces Overhaul, Applicants From Some Nations May Be Restricted
content: Studying or working in the UK will soon become difficult for nationals of certain countries. The update comes from the UK Home Office, which says it has been identifying countries from which visitors are most likely to overstay and claim asylum.

title: "Never Say Never": Trump To Carney's Canada Will "Never Be For Sale" Remark
content: US President Donald Trump began his first talks with Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney on Tuesday and vowed to bring up "tough points" that are dividing the two countries since Trump imposed tariffs.

title: NSG Commandos Visits Puri Jagannath Temple, Review Security
content: A four-member team of National Security Guard (NSG) commandos visited the Shri Jagannath Temple in Puri on Monday to carry out a routine security review as part of their annual calendar.

title: "India's Water Will Be Used For India's Interests": PM Modi's Message To Pak
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi has made it clear that the decision to put a freeze on the Indus water treaty that stopped the supply to Pakistan, will not be reversed, saying "India's water will be used for India's interests".

title: ICAR expels farmers’ member, who questioned genome-edited seeds, from governing body
content: The Indian Council of Agricultural Research (ICAR) expelled Varanasi-based farmer Venugopal Badaravada from the governing body as well as general body of the ICAR Society for sending various mails levying ‘frivolous, baseless and materially unsupported allegations’ against various authorities of the Centre, Department of Agricultural Research and Education and the ICAR over the last seven-eight months

title: Kodanad case: CB-CID questions Jayalalithaa’s former personal assistant Poongundran
content: According to sources, he was asked to give the details of the Kodanad bungalow’s CCTV camera system and whether any important documents were stored there

title: Over 10 crore pages of historic documents digitised by NAI, says Culture Minister
content: Making the announcement, Union Culture Minister Gajendra Singh Shekhawat said the digitisation project was taken up to make historic documents in possession of the NAI more accessible to the public.

title: Stalin government steps into fifth year, focuses on inclusive and equitable development
content: The Chief Minister said his sole aim was to bring Tamil Nadu back onto the path of progress and the four-year journey of the Dravidian model stood testimony to his administration’s success

title: PM Modi speaks to Emir of Qatar as India steps up West Asia outreach
content: Tamim Bin Hamad Al Thani expresses full support to India’s fight against terrorism and all actions to bring the perpetrators of Pahalgam attack to justice; New Delhi rejects OIC statement as absurd

title: Emigration Act 1983 designed to address demands of particular geography in a certain era, says External Affairs Minister
content: S. Jaishankar says countries like Italy, Japan, Spain, and Malaysia among others have expressed interest in hiring Indian professionals in both blue collar and white collar positions and described these opportunities as just the ‘tip of the iceberg’

title: Pahalgam terror attack: CRPF seeks explanation from its first responder
content: Commandant Rajesh Kumar with a team of 22 people had rushed to the scene of massacre; eyewitnesses and survivors say security personnel reached the scene after more than an hour

title: Civil defence drills to be organised in five districts of Karnataka
content: In Karnataka, Mallapura, Shaktinagara and Bengaluru have been included in Category II civil defence towns

title: Human rights commission orders probe into rabies deaths
content: The inquiry should identify preventive measures to ensure such tragedies do not recur, according to the order

title: The first care home for beggars in Madras was established under police management
content:
On March 14, 1954, Chief Minister C. Rajagopalachari inaugurated a care home and camp at Melpakkam. The camp, which could accommodate 500 persons, started with 83 beggars. The inmates were given 2 square meals and kanji every day. The Medical Officer of the Government Dispensary at Poonamalee
visited them daily

title: India-U.K. FTA deal: Farmers’ outfits decry India-U.K. trade pact as threat to agriculture and small industries
content: Samyukt Kisan Morcha, allied unions allege pact enables ‘economic imperialism’, bypasses Parliamentary scrutiny, and endangers national interests

title: Rules for Cubbon Park: Government Order specifies what’s allowed and what’s prohibited
content: From a cap on the number of people who can gather for an event to a ban on consumption of food and certain toys, the guidelines have covered several aspects

title: The tale of Bharatha Matha temple, a pet project of C.R. Das and Subramania Siva
content:
Congress stalwarts C.R. Das and Subramania Siva initiated the 
Bharatha Matha temple at Paparapatti in Dharmapuri. After Siva died, it went out of public discourse. In June 2018, Chief Minister 
Edappadi K. Palaniswami of the AIADMK announced that the temple would be built at an estimated cost of ₹1.5 crore. It was declared open in August 2021

title: Government bans Indian satellite internet terminals from working outside India
content: The Department of Telecommunications issued a series of additional guidelines to satellite internet services, even as SpaceX’s Starlink continues to await the greenlight to offer its services in India.

title: Namma Metro introduces QR code ticket-vending machines at Byappanahalli station
content: The move follows the successful pilot launch of similar machines at M.G. Road and Cubbon Park stations on the Purple Line

title: Aeroflot Flight From Bangkok To Moscow Makes Emergency Landing In Delhi
content: An Aeroflot aircraft from Bangkok to Moscow, carrying over 400 people, made an emergency landing at the Delhi airport on Tuesday, according to a source.

title: India's Free Trade Agreements: An Explainer
content: India finalised a free trade agreement with the UK, its 16th so far as the country aimed at boosting bilateral trade and investments.

title: Moong Dal Halwa, Rice For Indian Astronaut's Travel To Space Station
content: Indian Air Force (IAF) Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla will carry moong dal halwa, Indian rice and Mango nectar among other Indian delicacies, when he flies to the International Space Station (ISS) next month, becoming the first Indian to do so.

title: Why Distributors Are Planning To Suspend Colgate Products' Purchase
content: Distributors of Colgate Palmolive have decided to suspend purchase of all its products in Maharastra from May 12 alleging that the company was offering deep discounts to quick-commerce channels, which is against the interest of general trade.

title: Pakistani Man Arrested Along LoC In J&K's Poonch
content: A 26-year-old Pakistani intruder was arrested along the Line of Control in Jammu and Kashmir's Poonch district on Tuesday, officials said.

title: BJP demands unconditional apology from Congress, calls Kharge’s remarks ‘irresponsible’
content: Party accuses Congress of weakening national security and aligning with anti-India narratives following remarks on Kashmir visit

title: Implement pre-exposure prophylaxis programme in State to prevent rabies death: KGMOA
content: If a person who has taken PrEP vaccine sustains animal bite, they nned to take only two booster shots

title: BBMP chief inspects footpaths in Bengaluru, issues slew of directions
content: Maheshwar Rao instructs officials to prioritise pedestrian infrastructure, remove encroachments, and widen the footpath at Shantala Silk Junction using the space available inside the bus stand

title: Population-based delimitation is fair, says BJP ally Upendra Kushwaha
content: Southern States were ‘denying the rights’ of other States, the Rashtriya Lok Morcha chief said it was the right of citizens in the Hindi-speaking States to be allocated Lok Sabha seats according to their numbers

title: To check fake news, government rethinks safe harbour for online platforms
content: Intermediary platforms such as YouTube, Facebook, Instagram and X currently enjoy a safe harbour under Section 79 of Information Technology Act 2000

title: Financial impropriety forced Modi govt. to remove Subramanian as IMF executive director: Congress
content: Congress spokesperson Supriya Shrinate alleged that Union Bank of India placed an order for two lakh copies of a book authored by Subramanian, who had earlier served as Chief Economic Adviser to the Union government

title: Dhinakaran criticises DMK govt. for not fulfilling poll promises
content: He say the ‘singular achievement’ of the DMK government is to rake up issues with a view to deflect “dissatisfaction” of the public with the performance of the government

title: Supreme Court details 221 names approved by the Chandrachud and Khanna Collegiums
content: Only half of recommended names cleared; data reveals low representation from SC, ST, and OBC communities in HC appointments

title: Kerala firm weaves its magic at Met Gala
content: The striking blue carpet sprinkled with yellow and white daffodils that graced the fashion’s most dazzling event had its origins at Cherthala

title: India well-placed to conduct caste census, says Prof. Sukhdeo Thorat
content: Expert suggests careful preparation, learning from past efforts; calls for data on caste discrimination and sub-categorisation

title: Kerala to go global with Apple TV series
content: The series is a celebration of Kerala’s evolving narrative as a prime tourism destination and will help Kerala Tourism’s novel campaigns

title: ₹25 lakh ex gratia handed over to kin of Simhachalam wall collapse victims
content: Patti Durga Swamy Naidu, 33, and K.M.E. Sesha Rao, 26, natives of Machavaram village in Ambajipeta Mandal in Dr. B.R. Ambedkar Konaseema District were killed in the wall collapse

title: Digital luggage locker facility at Thiruvananthapuram Central railway station
content: SafeCloak is a self-operable, digital luggage storage solution that allows passengers to securely store their bags for a desired duration

title: Samastha seeks revocation of Asgar Ali Faizy’s expulsion from Arabic college
content: Faizy, a veteran scholar and senior Mushawara member, was expelled from Jamia Nooriyya Arabic College in March reportedly in retaliation for his veiled criticism against Indian Union Muslim League (IUML) State president Sadikali Shihab Thangal

title: Pakistan tries to up ante but UNSC seeks accountability for Pahalgam attack
content: Pakistan's attempt to raise India-Pakistan tensions at a closed-door UN Security Council meeting failed to gain traction. Council members urged bilateral resolution and accountability for the Pahalgam terrorist attack, suspected to involve Lashkar-e-Taiba. Concerns were raised about Pakistan's nuclear rhetoric and missile tests.

title: Road crash victims will now get free, cashless treatment
content: The government has notified a scheme for free cashless treatment to road accident victims nationwide, complying with a Supreme Court deadline. Up to ₹1.5 lakh will be provided for treatment for a maximum of seven days at 30,000 designated hospitals. A steering committee will monitor the scheme's implementation, with ₹272 crore allocated for 2025-26.

title: Gujarat Titans snatch thrilling last-ball win over Mumbai Indians in a rain-hit thriller
content: In a thrilling, rain-interrupted match at Wankhede, the Gujarat Titans clinched a nail-biting three-wicket victory against the Mumbai Indians on the very last ball. Chasing 156, Shubman Gill's 43 and crucial contributions down the order guided the Titans to the top of the league standings.

title: US air-sea platforms for nukes at end-of-service period: Report
content: The US Congressional Budget Office projects that the cost of operating, sustaining, and modernizing US nuclear forces will surge to $946 billion between 2025 and 2034, a 25% increase from the previous estimate. This substantial investment includes modernizing delivery systems, weapons, facilities, and command and control systems. The rise is attributed to the need to replace aging legacy weapon systems and address cost overruns in programs like the Sentinel ICBM.

title: CEOs Microsoft, Adobe, IBM, Cognizant and others warn US is falling behind
content: Top CEOs, including Microsoft's Satya Nadella, are urging the U.S. to mandate computer science and AI education in K-12 schools. They warn that America is lagging behind countries like China and Singapore. The leaders emphasize that a single computer science course could boost wages by 8% and unlock significant economic potential.

title: IPL 2025 Points Table: Latest standings after GT vs MI match
content: Gujarat Titans surged to the top of the IPL 2025 points table after defeating Mumbai Indians, securing their eighth win. Royal Challengers Bengaluru and Punjab Kings closely follow, intensifying the playoff race. Delhi Capitals remain in contention, while Sunrisers Hyderabad were eliminated. Rajasthan Royals and Chennai Super Kings have bowed out of playoff contention, making every remaining match crucial.

title: Omar, Mehbooba question ‘mass detentions’ after Pahalgam attack
content: Following the Pahalgam attack, Omar Abdullah and Mehbooba Mufti voiced concerns over large-scale detentions in J&K, fearing a message of collective punishment. Mehbooba highlighted that thousands of civilians have been taken into custody, with over 3,000 arrests and nearly 100 PSA detentions reported, urging a review of this approach to avoid deepening the trust deficit.

title: Iran foreign minister takes first strike in Pak as ‘mediator’, to land in Delhi today
content: Iranian Foreign Minister Abbas Araghchi's recent diplomatic efforts in Islamabad, including meetings with Pakistani leaders, centered on mediating the escalating tensions between India and Pakistan following the Pahalgam terrorist attack. Despite India's reluctance to accept third-party mediation, Iran is positioning itself as a regional conciliator, leveraging its ties with both nations to push for de-escalation.

title: Amazon changing salary structure, here's who new guidelines favour
content: Amazon is revamping its compensation strategy, rewarding veteran top performers with up to 110% of their pay range for consistent excellence over four years. First-time high achievers and those with fluctuating performance will see reduced payouts.

title: Calcutta high court: Lawyers now aligned with political parties
content: Calcutta High Court expressed concern over lawyers' political alignment and declining court decorum during a hearing on alleged police overreach in the Murshidabad violence case. Justice Tirthankar Ghosh observed that lawyers' power seems to stem from outside the courtroom, leading to heated exchanges. He refused to entertain the plea, directing it to a division bench already addressing Murshidabad violence-related cases.

title: New proposal: Pay Rs 7L, have 40 beach weddings in 3 years
content: The Goa Coastal Zone Management Authority (GCZMA) is considering a proposal to allow event organizers to obtain a three-year permit for hosting up to 40 weddings on specific beach stretches for a fee of Rs 7 lakh. The GCZMA has also proposed changes to application fees for various construction projects, including hotels, swimming pools, and infrastructure for petroleum products, while introducing fees for flood protection walls and coastal structures.

title: Army duo dead, 3 injured in Kupwara road accident
content: In a tragic incident near the Line of Control in Kupwara, an Army vehicle accident resulted in the death of two soldiers and injuries to two others. The vehicle plunged into a deep gorge after the driver lost control. This unfortunate event follows a similar accident in Ramban just two days prior, where three Army personnel lost their lives.

title: Elon Musk is no longer ‘Elon Musk’ on Twitter; changes profile name to…
content: Elon Musk has once again altered his X display name, this time to 'Gorklon Rust,' sparking speculation about its meaning. The moniker appears to blend references to Grok, Musk's AI chatbot, and the Rust programming language, potentially linked to xAI's infrastructure.

title: Supreme Court to Centre: Publish road accidents report 2023 by August
content: The Supreme Court has instructed the road transport ministry to release the "Road Accidents in India 2023" report by August, emphasizing the need for timely publication within six months of each calendar year's end for its utility. Concerns are raised by road safety experts regarding delays in publishing crucial accident data, hindering effective interventions. The National Crime Records Bureau is also yet to release its 2023 report.

title: Four dead as bus falls into Poonch gorge
content: A passenger bus accident in Jammu and Kashmir's Poonch district resulted in the tragic loss of four lives, including an Army soldier on leave, and left over 40 individuals injured. The bus, en route from Ghani to Mendhar, veered off course and plunged into a deep gorge, prompting immediate rescue efforts by locals, police, Army, and CRPF personnel.

title: Cheaper cars & whisky: What FTA with UK means for India
content: India and the UK have finalized a Free Trade Agreement, poised to boost economic growth and trade relations. The agreement eliminates tariffs on approximately 99% of traded goods, benefiting sectors like manufacturing, textiles, and automotive. It also includes provisions for professional visas and reduced duties on products like Scotch whisky and cars, fostering job creation and deeper collaboration.

title: Pak plans to increase defence budget by 18%: How it compares with India
content: Amidst escalating tensions following the Pahalgam attack, Pakistan plans to increase its defence budget by 18%. India, a major military power, spends significantly more but faces resource allocation challenges. With China's support for Pakistan and its own growing military strength, India confronts a two-front challenge. Recent actions include ceasefire violations, mock drills, and nuclear modernization, highlighting the complex security landscape.

title: Tirupati’s annual folk festival begins at Sri Tataiahgunta Gangamma temple
content: Priests tied ‘Vadibalu’ to the stone pillar located in front of the temple to announce the commencement of the festival

title: Stone laid for ₹12.72 crore Flatted Factory Complex in Srikalahasti
content: The project will be developed on 1.04 acres of land and will include 30 industrial units, with designated space for banks, storage and administrative facilities

title: India up three spots to 130 among 193 nations in Human Development Index, but inequality persists
content: UNDP’s 2025 Human Development Report highlights the critical role of AI in shaping the next chapter of human development, particularly in fast-growing economies, including India

title: Thrissur Pooram: A dazzling tapestry of tradition and revelry
content: Unique in its grandeur, rituals, and celebrations, Thrissur Pooram draws thousands of devotees and spectators from around the world. It is a fascinating fusion of sacred ceremonies, traditional performances, dazzling fireworks, and majestic elephant parades

title: India-U.K. free trade agreements highlights
content: India ensures that non-tariff barriers are suitably addressed to ensure free flow of goods and services and that they do not create unjustified restrictions to its exports.

title: TTD convenes an emergency meeting on April 7
content: The meeting is being convened urgently at the direction of the government to deliberate on key issues that demand an immediate resolution

title: Catch-22 situation? Cong balances between attacking & backing govt over Pak
content: Mallikarjun Kharge alleged PM Modi cancelled his Kashmir visit after an intelligence report warned of an attack and questioned why security wasn't reinforced for civilians if there was intelligent inputs. The BJP strongly condemned Kharge's remarks, accusing him of echoing Pakistan's narrative and demanding an apology.

title: China warns ‘unprecedented huge risks’ to global economy from US tariffs
content: China's finance minister has criticized US tariffs for destabilizing the global economy, while the foreign ministry insists the US must drop its threatening stance for any agreement. The ongoing trade dispute escalates as the US imposes high tariffs, prompting retaliation from Beijing. Despite hints of possible trade talks, China demands the removal of tariffs, a condition President Trump has dismissed.

title: MI vs GT: Hardik Pandya equals a unique record in IPL
content: Hardik Pandya equaled an unwanted IPL record, bowling an 11-ball over against Gujarat Titans, conceding 18 runs with five extras. Despite Jacks' half-century and Suryakumar's contribution, Mumbai Indians struggled, losing seven wickets for 58 runs. Gujarat's spinners capitalized, restricting Mumbai to a paltry score after they failed to build on a promising start.

title: Dead snakelet found in Hosur temple prasad
content: Devotees at the Chandra Choodeswarar Temple in Hosur were shocked to discover a dead snakelet in the 'puliyodharai' prasad. A complaint was filed by a devotee after the incident, prompting the temple to dispose of all the prasad and launch an investigation.

title: India-UK FTA to boost bilateral trade to $100 bn by 2030: Industry bodies
content: Industry organizations have lauded the India-UK Free Trade Agreement (FTA), anticipating significant support for Indian exporters aiming to expand in the UK market amidst global economic uncertainties. The FTA aspires to elevate bilateral trade to USD 100 billion by 2030, removing customs duties on 99% of Indian goods entering British markets.

title: 'Cover fire for terrorists': India envoy blasts Irish Times over J&K attack editorial
content: Indian ambassador Akhilesh Mishra strongly criticized The Irish Times for its editorial on the Pahalgam terror attack, accusing it of downplaying terrorism and echoing narratives that support its perpetrators. Mishra highlighted the editorial's failure to condemn the attack unequivocally and its criticism of PM Modi.

title: 'At behest of Pakistan': MEA rejects OIC statement on Pahalgam attack
content: India's Ministry of External Affairs has strongly refuted the Organization of Islamic Cooperation's (OIC) statement regarding the Pahalgam terror attack, labeling it "absurd and misguided." The MEA spokesperson accused Pakistan of manipulating the OIC to issue a self-serving statement, rejecting any interference in India's internal matters.

title: India squad for England tour: BCCI secretary gives a major update
content: The Indian squad for the England tour will be selected in two weeks, confirmed BCCI secretary Devajit Saikia. India A players, already in a prepared pool, are set to depart on May 25 for three four-day games before the Test series commencing June 20.

title: 'Gaurav Gogoi's wife continued receiving salary from Pak': Himanta
content: Assam chief minister Himanta Biswa Sarma has accused Congress MP Gaurav Gogoi and his wife of having links to Pakistan, alleging suspicious travels and activities. Sarma claims Gogoi visited Pakistan personally for 15 days, while his wife made multiple trips accompanied by Pakistani officials. Gogoi has dismissed the allegations as petty politics, accusing Sarma of involving his family.

title: Avneet Kaur spotted in stands during GT vs MI match
content: Avneet Kaur's presence at an IPL match sparked social media buzz after Virat Kohli's account seemingly liked her photo. Kohli attributed it to an algorithm error, requesting no assumptions. Singer Rahul Vaidya then mocked Kohli's explanation, suggesting similar 'glitches' could affect him and humorously claiming Kohli blocked him due to the post, possibly another 'algorithm' issue.

title: Yemen's Sanaa airport 'completely destroyed' in Israeli strike, say officials
content: An Israeli airstrike has reportedly caused the complete destruction of Sanaa airport in Yemen, following a Houthi missile attack targeting Israel's Ben Gurion Airport. The strikes also hit power stations, causing power cuts in Sanaa and Hodeida. The Houthis have vowed to retaliate, declaring their continued support for Gaza amidst ongoing Red Sea attacks.

title: India to hold mega civil defence drill after Pakistan-backed J&K attack
content: India is set to conduct a nationwide civil defence mock drill, focusing on the designated 'civil defence districts' some of which house sensitive installations. This exercise, amidst heightened tensions following a recent terror attack, aims to simulate wartime scenarios, testing air raid protocols and evacuation plans.

title: Gautam Gambhir opens up on his relationship with Virat Kohli
content: Gautam Gambhir addressed his past on-field clashes with Virat Kohli, clarifying that their bond remains strong despite representing opposing teams. He humorously dismissed rumors fueled by their IPL interactions, attributing them to TRP-driven speculation. Gambhir lauded Kohli's contributions to Indian cricket and even expressed admiration for his exceptional fitness, jokingly requesting the BCCI to limit social media posts about them.

title: Buttery fingers! Gujarat Titans drop 3 catches inside powerplay vs Mumbai Indians
content: Gujarat Titans' decision to bowl first was marred by sloppy fielding, dropping three crucial catches in the powerplay and gifting Mumbai Indians early opportunities. Despite Mohammed Siraj's early breakthrough and Arshad Khan's tight bowling, missed chances off Will Jacks and Suryakumar Yadav proved costly. Shubman Gill noted Rabada's absence, while Hardik Pandya welcomed batting first, emphasizing execution.

title: Watch: Ashish Nehra wildly celebrates Rohit Sharma's dismissal in MI vs GT
content: Gujarat Titans' coach Ashish Nehra celebrated Rohit Sharma's dismissal by left-arm seamer Arshad Khan. This marks the third instance in the tournament where a left-arm bowler has claimed Sharma's wicket. Since IPL 2023, Sharma has been dismissed twelve times by left-arm seamers, highlighting a vulnerability. Trent Boult has dismissed Sharma six times in T20s.

title: What is India-UK Free Trade Agreement? Explained in 15 points
content: India and the UK have finalized a significant free trade agreement. The agreement ensures duty-free access to UK markets for 99% of Indian exports. India will reduce import duties on 90% of tariff lines, benefiting consumers with lower prices on various goods.

title: 'Dangerous culture': Bombay HC slams police for 'copy-pasting' witness statements
content: The Bombay High Court has expressed serious concerns about police officers routinely copy-pasting witness statements into charge sheets, even in serious criminal cases, cautioning that this "dangerous culture" could benefit the accused. The court has directed the Maharashtra government to issue guidelines for recording witness statements and appointed an amicus curiae to suggest improvements to investigation quality.

title: Groom gets wedding gifts of Rs15 cr including petrol pump, 210 Bighas land
content: A viral video from an Indian wedding showcases extravagant gifts given to the groom by the bride's family, including silver, a petrol pump, and land worth INR 15.65 crore. While the video garnered significant attention, it sparked debate about the prevalence of dowry, a deeply rooted social evil in India.

title: India vs Pakistan cricket relations: Gautam Gambhir makes a big statement
content: Gautam Gambhir, the current Team India head coach, has firmly stated that there should be no relationship with Pakistan, especially in cricket and entertainment, following the Pahalgam terror attack. He emphasized that the nation's people and soldiers are more important.

title: Random Musings: How Kash Patel broke every stereotype about Indian-Americans
content: For decades, Indian-American success stories followed a predictable script: study hard, stay quiet, become a doctor, maybe build an app, and always say thank you. Kash Patel took that script, lit it on fire, and walked into the FBI wearing sunglasses and sacred threads — chanting “Jai Shree Krishna” while rewriting the rules of power in Washington.

title: Gautam Gambhir: 'Hindustan ki cricket kisi ki jagir nahi hai'
content: Gautam Gambhir, at the ABP India At 2047 Summit, strongly responded to criticism surrounding his coaching. He asserted his focus is on national pride, not pleasing commentators, and criticized former players treating Indian cricket as their domain. Gambhir defended his past actions and emphasized his commitment to building a fearless team, prioritizing accountability and nationalism over personal gain.

title: 'PM Modi had intel': Kharge's big claim on Pahalgam attack; BJP hits back
content: Congress president Mallikarjun Kharge accused Prime Minister Narendra Modi of withholding intelligence about the impending terrorist attack in Pahalgam, Jammu and Kashmir. Kharge linked the postponement of PM Modi's Srinagar visit to the attack, questioning why the intelligence wasn't shared with security forces. He criticized the government for alleged intelligence failure and inadequate security for tourists following the attack.

title: Paul Skenes’ wife Livvy Dunne responds to viral backlash with grace
content: Livvy Dunne's "Riders Up" rallying call didn't exactly go according to plan, but she took the online criticism with a calm and sense of humor. Instead of overreacting, she went low-key and remained herself. As she sets off on life post-gymnastics, one thing is certain: Livvy Dunne’s star power won't be extinguished.

title: Follow live: Inter strike first vs. Barcelona in semifinal second leg
content: We are down to the final four! It's the first day of the second legs in the semifinals of the 2024-25  UEFA Champions League  season. Enjoy the play-by-play from Tuesday's game:  Internazionale  against  Barcelona , live from the Stadio Giuseppe Meazza in Milan, Italy. Jump to:   UCL home page  |  Liveblog

title: Power 4 coaches on the NFL draft: Intel on Shedeur Sanders' slide, sleeper picks and six schools' classes
content: the draft kicks off just as college football's spring transfer portal window was set to close . college coaches were focused on the final few pieces of their rosters for the 2025 season . the transfer portal itself is also a factor, as the increased movement of players exposes them to more coaches .

title: NBA conference semifinals: Late surge gives Nuggets 1-0 lead over OKC
content: no. 4 seed Indiana Pacers beat the no. 1 seed Cleveland Cavaliers 121-112 in the Eastern and Western conference semifinals . on monday, the Northeast's third-seeded New York Knicks beat the 2-seed Boston Celtics in an overtime thriller in Game 1 behind Jalen Brunson .

title: Our final college softball rankings of the 2025 regular season: Top 25 poll and what to watch
content: the final week of play brought upsets (sorry, Oklahoma and UCLA) and standout performances (shoutout to Texas' Mia Scott). there's a new no. 1 team yet again with Texas A&M moving up after winning its weekend series over Tennessee .

title: Waiver wire: Why settle for one rising star when you can have two?
content: a pair of young hitters who put on power displays over the weekend are among the top fantasy baseball pickups . they're beginning to flourish at the big-league level, albeit for different teams . the 2025 fantasy baseball season is here, or start a brand new tradition .

title: Returning the Bundesliga crown to Bayern is a job well done for Kompany
content: germany's most successful club tasting success as Sofa-Meister (couch champions) celebrated as a group on Sunday at the Käfer restaurant in desirable Bogenhausen . on Saturday, the party proper will commence in front of 75,000 at the allianz Arena against Borussia Monchengladbach .

title: This time at UCF, Scott Frost won't need to catch lightning in a bottle
content: Scott Frost is reuniting with the UCF Knights as their new head coach . the Knights are now in a power 4 conference, and there is now a 12-team college football playoff . he is a new coach at the university of central Florida .

title: The most astounding numbers of Aaron Judge's torrid start to 2025
content: Aaron Judge is hitting an astounding .423/.510/.777 with 10 extra-base hits during his eighth-inning double Sunday . he leads the majors in batting average, on-base percentage, slugging percentage, OPS and hits .

title: NBA playoff odds: Big changes after Game 1 wins by Knicks, Nuggets
content: the defending champion Boston Celtics squandered a 20-point lead against the new york Knicks . the Cleveland Cavaliers look to even the series against the Indiana Pacers after losing on their homecourt in the series opener .

title: Things got 'awkward': Jim Knowles opens up about move from Ohio State to Penn State
content: Ohio State defensive coordinator Jim Knowles opted to leave for Penn State . Knowles is widely regarded as one of the top defensive coordinators in the country . his defense last year ranked No. 1 in points allowed per game, yards allow per game .

title: College baseball Week 12: Top 25 rankings and what to watch
content: Coastal Carolina jumped up five spots, making room for the USC Trojans to be ranked for the first time tuesday . wehiwa aloy and Kuhio Aloy are among the best players on the team's roster . cnn's david mccarthy takes a look back at some of the best plays from u.s. players .

title: Previewing Capitals-Canes, Knights-Oilers
content: the two teams went 2-2 in their regular-season series in 2024-25, with the Canes outscoring the Caps 14-10 on aggregate . the game pits the Carolina Hurricanes against the Washington Capitals ( 7 p.m. ET, ESPN ).

title: Grand Theft Auto VI releases information on main characters
content: a new trailer for the game has been released, showcasing the two main characters . the duo is described as wanting "an easy life" that somehow keeps avoiding him . "Meeting Lucia could be the best or worst thing to ever happen to him," the description says .
